firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure Authorization Independence, support required QAPs (Queries and Permissions), and maintain data clarity.  Authorization Independence is achieved by structuring data around user-owned subcollections, eliminating the need for `get()` calls in security rules. Each user has their own collections for categories, expenses and incomes. This segregation inherently supports QAPs, as listing operations are scoped to a user's data. This allows us to make rules simple since we can securely assume ownership based on the collection path.  There is no collaborative data for this app, so a membership map is not needed.
